name: Agriculture is King
title: Agricultural Dominance
description: In 2023, agriculture, forestry, and fishing contributed to 47.81% of Niger's GDP, showcasing the country's reliance on these sectors for economic stability.

name: Education's Great Divide
title: Education Disparity
description: In 2019, 100% of female primary school-age children were out-of-school, highlighting a significant challenge in achieving gender parity in education.

name: Youth Unemployment Challenge
title: High Youth Unemployment
description: In 2023, 72.29% of adolescents were out of school, indicating a high rate of youth unemployment and educational disengagement.

name: Health Cost Burden
title: Healthcare-Induced Poverty
description: In 2018, 78.53% of the population was pushed further below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket healthcare expenses, indicating a significant financial burden on households.

name: Clean Air Crisis
title: Severe Air Pollution
description: In 2020, Niger experienced a mean annual PM2.5 air pollution level of 85.12 micrograms per cubic meter, posing serious health risks to its population.

name: Bed Nets Success
title: Effective Malaria Prevention
description: In 2015, 95.5% of the under-5 population used insecticide-treated bed nets, demonstrating effective malaria prevention efforts.

name: Child Mortality Concern
title: High Child Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, Niger had an under-5 mortality rate of 114.8 per 1,000 live births, highlighting significant challenges in child health and survival.

name: Informal Competition
title: Prevalence of Informal Firms
description: In 2017, 85.1% of firms reported competition from unregistered firms, indicating a significant informal sector presence.

name: Education Struggles
title: Low Educational Attainment
description: In 2022, only 8.45% of Niger's population aged 25+ had completed lower secondary education, and a mere 1.38% had completed post-secondary education. This highlights significant challenges in educational attainment.

name: Youth Employment Success
title: Low Youth Unemployment Rates
description: Niger boasts impressively low youth unemployment rates, with only 0.397% of the youth labor force unemployed in 2022, according to national estimates.

name: Female Workforce Stability
title: Low Female Unemployment
description: In 2022, Niger had a low female unemployment rate of 0.29%, showcasing a relatively stable female workforce.

name: Insurance Gaps
title: Limited Social Insurance Coverage
description: As of 2021, only 21.45% of the population in the third quintile had access to social insurance programs, indicating gaps in social safety nets.

name: Industry Employment Challenge
title: Low Male Employment in Industry
description: In 2023, only 5.42% of Niger's male workforce was employed in the industry sector, reflecting limited industrial job opportunities.

name: Healthy Kids
title: Low Prevalence of Overweight Children
description: In 2022, only 0.5% of female children under 5 were overweight, indicating a low prevalence of childhood obesity.

name: Secondary School Progress
title: Moderate Progression to Secondary School
description: In 2015, 58.27% of students progressed to secondary school, with a slightly lower rate of 56.04% for females, indicating moderate educational progression.
